remarks: The convergent points of a finite topological group sum are the closure of the finite group sum operation.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Sep-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 24-Jul-2019.)
statement:
tsmsid.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
tsmsid.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
tsmsid.1 $e |- ( ph -> G e. CMnd ) $.
tsmsid.2 $e |- ( ph -> G e. TopSp ) $.
tsmsid.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
tsmsid.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
tsmsid.w $e |- ( ph -> F finSupp .0. ) $.
tsmsgsum.j $e |- J = ( TopOpen ` G ) $.
tsmsgsum $p |- ( ph -> ( G tsums F ) = ( ( cls ` J ) ` { ( G gsum F ) } ) ) $.
